title: Vision
excerpt: Baseline rules for how creatures perceive the world through sight.
markdown:
# Vision

Vision is the primary way most creatures perceive their surroundings. A creature's ability to see is governed by the lighting conditions of its environment.

### Normal Vision
Creatures without special senses rely on **Normal Vision**. This baseline interaction with light determines what you can see and how well you can see it:

*   **[[bright_light|Bright Light]]**: You see normally. No penalties apply to sight-based checks.
*   **[[dim_light|Dim Light]]**: Creates a [[obscured_areas|Lightly Obscured]] area. You have **Disadvantage** on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
*   **[[darkness|Darkness]]**: Creates a [[obscured_areas|Heavily Obscured]] area. You effectively have the [[blinded_condition|Blinded]] condition when trying to see something in this area.

### Enhancing Vision
Many creatures have traits that upgrade their vision, such as [[darkvision|Darkvision]], which allows them to ignore some of the penalties of low light. Other creatures possess [[special_senses|Special Senses]] like Blindsight or Truesight that allow them to perceive the world without relying on light at all.
